canonical_explanation.text: Our body needs six nutrients: carbohydrates (energy), proteins (growth and repair), fats (stored energy), vitamins (protection from diseases), minerals (body functions), and water (essential for all processes). A balanced diet contains all nutrients in right amounts. Deficiency diseases occur when nutrients are lacking: scurvy (Vitamin C), rickets (Vitamin D), anaemia (iron), goitre (iodine), night blindness (Vitamin A). Communicable diseases spread through air, water, contact, or food. Good hygiene practices like handwashing prevent diseases. Basic first aid includes cleaning cuts, cooling burns, and knowing when to seek help.
rules: Balanced diet: all nutrients in right amounts
Night blindness: lack of Vitamin A

questions.question_text: Which nutrient provides energy to our body?
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates provide energy to our body. They are the main source of fuel that keeps us going and helps us do all our daily activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Proteins are important for growth and repair of our body, but they do not directly provide energy. Vitamins and minerals are also essential nutrients, but they do not give us energy. The right answer is carbohydrates, which are the main nutrients that give us the energy to move, think, and function.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient is needed for growth and repair of body tissues?
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are the nutrients needed for growth and repair of the body's tissues. They help build and maintain muscles, bones, and other body parts as we grow and replace old cells.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Carbohydrates, fats, and water are all important nutrients, but they do not directly help grow and repair body tissues. Proteins are the building blocks that our body uses to build and fix muscles, organs, and other parts as we develop and replace old cells.

questions.question_text: How many types of nutrients does our body need?
questions.explanation_correct: Our body needs six main nutrients - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. This is the complete set of nutrients required for our body to function properly, so the correct answer is D) Six.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The body does not need just three, four, or five nutrients. It needs all six main nutrients - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water - for energy, growth, protection from diseases, and proper body functions. So the correct answer is D) Six nutrients.

questions.question_text: Rice, bread, and potatoes are rich in:
questions.explanation_correct: Rice, bread, and potatoes are all rich in carbohydrates, which are the main source of energy for our body. Carbohydrates help us run, play, and do all our daily activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, bread, and potatoes are not rich in proteins, vitamins, or minerals. These foods are mainly composed of carbohydrates, which provide us with the energy we need. Proteins, vitamins, and minerals are found in other food groups like meat, eggs, fruits, and vegetables.

questions.question_text: Milk, eggs, and pulses are rich sources of:
questions.explanation_correct: Milk, eggs, and pulses (like lentils, beans, peas) are good sources of proteins. Proteins are important for the growth and repair of our body tissues.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk, eggs, and pulses are not rich sources of carbohydrates, fats, or vitamins. These foods contain a lot of proteins, which are the building blocks for our muscles, skin, and other body parts. Proteins help our body grow and repair itself.

questions.question_text: Scurvy is caused by lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by a lack of vitamin C. Vitamin C is important for maintaining healthy gums and skin, and helping the body fight infections. Without enough vitamin C, the body can develop scurvy, which causes bleeding gums, tooth loss, and other problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scurvy is not caused by a lack of vitamins A, B, or D. Vitamin C is the nutrient that is needed to prevent scurvy. It helps the body produce collagen, which keeps the gums and skin healthy. Not getting enough vitamin C leads to the symptoms of scurvy like bleeding gums and loose teeth.

questions.question_text: Rickets is caused by lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Rickets is caused by a lack of Vitamin D, which is necessary for the body to absorb calcium and build strong bones. That's why the correct answer is option C, Vitamin D.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rickets is not caused by a lack of Vitamin A, Vitamin C, or Vitamin E. Those vitamins are important for other functions in the body, but Vitamin D is specifically needed for healthy bone development. So the correct answer is Vitamin D, not the other options.

questions.question_text: Goitre is caused by lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Goitre is caused by a lack of the mineral iodine. Iodine is important for the proper functioning of the thyroid gland, which regulates growth and metabolism in the body. Without enough iodine, the thyroid gland cannot work properly, leading to a condition called goitre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Goitre is not caused by a lack of iron, calcium, or sodium. These minerals have different functions in the body. Iodine is the specific mineral that is needed for the thyroid gland to work properly. If the body does not get enough iodine, it can lead to the development of goitre.

questions.question_text: A diet that contains all nutrients in right amounts is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet is the correct answer because it contains all the essential nutrients our body needs in the right amounts - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. This helps keep our body healthy and prevents diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A heavy or light diet is not the correct answer. A heavy diet has too many nutrients, while a light diet does not have enough. A protein diet focuses on just one type of nutrient, which is not a balanced diet. The right answer is a balanced diet, which has all the nutrients our body needs in the right proportions.

questions.question_text: Diseases that spread from person to person are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Diseases that spread from one person to another are called communicable diseases. This is because they can be passed on to other people through the air, water, contact, or food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Deficiency diseases are caused by a lack of certain nutrients in the body, like scurvy from lack of Vitamin C. Genetic diseases are passed down from parents, and lifestyle diseases are caused by unhealthy habits. Communicable diseases are the ones that can spread from person to person, which is why 'communicable diseases' is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Butter and oil are rich sources of:
questions.explanation_correct: Butter and oil are rich in fats, which are a type of nutrient that provides stored energy for the body. Fats are an important part of a balanced diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Butter and oil are not rich in carbohydrates, proteins, or vitamins. Carbohydrates provide energy, proteins help with growth and repair, and vitamins help protect the body from diseases. Butter and oil are instead a good source of fats, which are an essential nutrient for the body.

questions.question_text: Night blindness is caused by lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Night blindness is caused by a lack of Vitamin A. Vitamin A is important for good eyesight, and a deficiency in it can make it hard to see in the dark or in dim light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Night blindness is not caused by a lack of Vitamins B, C, or D. These vitamins are important for other functions in the body, but they do not directly affect eyesight. Vitamin A is the vitamin that is needed for good vision, especially in low light conditions.

questions.question_text: Anaemia is caused by lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: Anaemia is caused by a lack of iron in the body. Iron is needed to make hemoglobin, which is the red pigment in our blood that carries oxygen. Without enough iron, the body cannot produce enough hemoglobin, leading to anaemia.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Anaemia is not caused by a lack of calcium, iodine, or sodium. These nutrients have different functions in the body. Calcium is important for strong bones and teeth, iodine is needed for a healthy thyroid gland, and sodium helps regulate fluid balance. Anaemia specifically happens when there is not enough iron in the body to make hemoglobin, the substance in red blood cells that carries oxygen.

questions.question_text: Which of the following spreads through contaminated water?
questions.explanation_correct: Cholera is a disease that spreads through contaminated water. When people drink water that has been polluted, they can get cholera, which causes severe diarrhoea and dehydration. This is the correct answer because cholera is a waterborne disease.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Common cold and skin infections do not spread through contaminated water. Headache is a symptom, not a disease that can spread. Cholera is the only option that is a disease that can spread through contaminated water.

questions.question_text: Which practice helps prevent the spread of diseases?
questions.explanation_correct: Washing hands regularly helps prevent the spread of diseases because it removes germs and bacteria that can make us sick. Good hygiene practices like handwashing are important to stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating junk food, not washing hands, and drinking dirty water can all spread diseases. This is because germs and bacteria can get into our body through food, water, or by touching unclean things. The best way to prevent diseases is by washing our hands regularly with soap and water.

questions.question_text: Why do we need water in our diet?
questions.explanation_correct: We need water in our diet for all the processes in our body to work properly. Water is essential for digestion, circulation, and removing waste from the body. Our body needs water to function well, so we must have enough water in our diet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not just needed for energy or growth. It is needed for all the important processes that happen in our body, like digestion, transporting nutrients, and removing waste. Without enough water, our body cannot work properly. That's why water is essential in our diet, not just for certain functions but for all the things our body needs to do.

questions.question_text: Common cold spreads through:
questions.explanation_correct: The common cold is a virus that spreads through the air when an infected person coughs or sneezes. The virus gets into the air and can be breathed in by others, causing them to get sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The common cold does not spread through water or food. It also does not spread through soil. The correct way the common cold spreads is through the air when an infected person coughs or sneezes, releasing tiny virus-containing droplets that can be breathed in by others.

questions.question_text: What should you do first when you get a minor cut?
questions.explanation_correct: Cleaning the wound is the first step to take when you get a minor cut. This helps prevent infection by removing dirt and germs from the cut.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Applying ice or sleeping would not help the cut heal. Eating food is important, but it does not directly treat the cut. The best thing to do first is to clean the wound by washing it with soap and water. This helps stop the bleeding and lowers the risk of infection.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin is obtained from sunlight?
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin D is obtained from sunlight. When our skin is exposed to sunlight, our body can produce Vitamin D. This vitamin is important for keeping our bones and teeth healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin D is obtained from sunlight, not from other vitamins like A, C, or E. When our skin is exposed to sunlight, our body can produce Vitamin D. This vitamin is important for keeping our bones and teeth healthy, so option C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a deficiency disease?
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is a deficiency disease caused by lack of Vitamin C. It can cause symptoms like bleeding gums, weakness, and skin problems. This makes scurvy the correct answer from the options given.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not deficiency diseases. Common cold and cholera are communicable diseases that spread through germs. Malaria is caused by a parasite, not a nutrient deficiency. Only scurvy, caused by lack of Vitamin C, is a deficiency disease from the choices provided.

questions.question_text: Calcium is a mineral that helps in:
questions.explanation_correct: Calcium is a mineral that helps build strong bones and teeth. It makes them hard and sturdy, so they can support our body and last for a long time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Calcium does not provide energy to the body. That is the job of carbohydrates. Calcium also does not help with digesting food - that is done by enzymes. While calcium is important for a healthy immune system, it does not specifically fight cold. The correct answer is that calcium helps build strong bones and teeth.

questions.question_text: Fruits and vegetables are rich sources of:
questions.explanation_correct: Fruits and vegetables are rich in vitamins and minerals, which help protect our body from diseases and keep us healthy. That's why the correct answer is C, vitamins and minerals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fruits and vegetables are not mainly made up of fats (option A) or carbohydrates (option D). They do not contain a lot of proteins either (option B). The right answer is C, vitamins and minerals, because fruits and vegetables are excellent sources of these important nutrients that our body needs.

questions.question_text: For a minor burn, you should:
questions.explanation_correct: Cooling the burn with running water is the best way to treat a minor burn. This helps reduce the heat and prevent further damage to the skin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should not apply ice directly to the burn, as this can further damage the skin. Applying butter or covering with a cloth can trap heat and make the burn worse. The correct way is to cool the burn under running water, which helps reduce the heat and prevent more damage.

questions.question_text: Why should we cover our mouth when coughing?
questions.explanation_correct: When we cough, tiny germs from our mouth and nose can spread to others and make them sick. Covering our mouth with our hand or a tissue when we cough traps these germs and prevents them from spreading to other people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A and C are incorrect because covering our mouth when we cough is not just about being polite or looking good. It is actually an important way to prevent the spread of germs that can make other people sick. Option D is incorrect because the main reason to cover our mouth is to stop the germs from spreading, not to make less noise.

questions.question_text: A child who eats only rice and no vegetables may suffer from:
questions.explanation_correct: A child who eats only rice and no vegetables may suffer from vitamin deficiency. Rice does not have all the vitamins and minerals that a growing child needs to stay healthy, so the child may develop diseases like scurvy, rickets, or night blindness.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating only rice and no vegetables would not give the child too much energy or too much protein. In fact, the child may not get enough of these nutrients either. The correct answer is that the child may suffer from a vitamin deficiency, as rice alone does not provide all the vitamins and minerals needed for a balanced diet and good health.

questions.question_text: Bleeding gums and weak immunity are symptoms of:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Scurvy. Scurvy is a disease that happens when you don't get enough vitamin C in your diet. Bleeding gums and a weak immune system are some of the main symptoms of scurvy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Rickets is caused by a lack of vitamin D, goitre is caused by a lack of iodine, and anaemia is caused by a lack of iron. None of these have bleeding gums and weak immunity as their main symptoms. Scurvy, caused by a lack of vitamin C, is the disease that best matches the symptoms given in the question.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient helps store energy in the body?
questions.explanation_correct: Fats are a type of nutrient that helps store energy in the body. They act as a reserve source of energy that can be used when needed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamins, minerals, and water are important nutrients, but they do not store energy in the body. Fats are the nutrient that is used to store extra energy so that it can be used later when the body needs it.

questions.question_text: Communicable diseases are caused by:
questions.explanation_correct: Communicable diseases are caused by germs like bacteria and viruses. These germs can spread through the air, water, contact, or food, and make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Communicable diseases are not caused by lack of nutrients, too much food, or exercise. These things can affect our health in different ways, but communicable diseases are specifically caused by germs like bacteria and viruses that can spread from person to person.

questions.question_text: Weak bones in children may be a sign of:
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin D is important for building strong bones and teeth. A deficiency in vitamin D can cause weak and soft bones, a condition called rickets in children. This is why the correct answer is vitamin D deficiency.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Weak bones in children are not caused by a deficiency in vitamin A, iron, or iodine. Vitamin A helps with eyesight, iron helps with blood, and iodine helps the thyroid gland. The correct answer is vitamin D deficiency, which leads to weak and soft bones, a condition called rickets.

questions.question_text: Drinking boiled or filtered water helps prevent:
questions.explanation_correct: Drinking boiled or filtered water helps prevent water-borne diseases because it removes harmful germs and bacteria that can make you sick. Boiling or filtering water kills these disease-causing organisms, so you don't get illnesses spread through contaminated water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Drinking boiled or filtered water does not directly help prevent deficiency diseases like scurvy or rickets, which are caused by lack of specific vitamins and minerals in the diet. It also does not prevent all diseases, as there are many other ways diseases can spread besides water, like through the air or contact with sick people. The correct answer is that boiled or filtered water helps prevent water-borne diseases.

questions.question_text: Carbohydrates provide energy to our body.
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are one of the six main nutrients our body needs. They provide energy to our cells and muscles so we can move, think, and do our daily activities. This is why the statement 'Carbohydrates provide energy to our body' is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that carbohydrates do not provide energy, but this is not correct. Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body. They are broken down into glucose, which our cells use to produce energy. Without enough carbohydrates, our body would not have the energy it needs to function properly.

questions.question_text: Proteins help in growth and repair of the body.
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are an important nutrient that help in the growth and repair of all the cells and tissues in our body. They are essential for building new muscles, skin, hair and other body parts as we grow up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Proteins do not provide energy like carbohydrates and fats. Instead, they are the building blocks of our body and help in the growth and repair of all the cells and tissues. This is why the statement 'Proteins help in growth and repair of the body' is true.

questions.question_text: Scurvy is caused by lack of Vitamin D.
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by a lack of Vitamin C, not Vitamin D. Vitamin C is needed for healthy gums, skin, and blood vessels. If you don't get enough Vitamin C, you can get scurvy, which makes your gums bleed and your skin get spots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scurvy is not caused by a lack of Vitamin D. Vitamin D is important for strong bones and teeth, but it has nothing to do with scurvy. Scurvy is caused by not getting enough Vitamin C in your diet. Vitamin C is needed for healthy gums, skin, and blood vessels.

questions.question_text: A balanced diet contains all nutrients in the right amounts.
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet contains the right amounts of all six nutrients our body needs: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. This ensures our body gets everything it needs to function properly and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A balanced diet does not just mean eating a lot of different foods. It means eating the right amounts of all the nutrients our body needs. If we don't get enough of one nutrient, like Vitamin C or iron, we can develop deficiency diseases. A truly balanced diet has the perfect balance of all six key nutrients.

questions.question_text: Common cold can spread through coughing and sneezing.
questions.explanation_correct: The common cold is a communicable disease, which means it can spread from one person to another. Coughing and sneezing are the main ways the cold virus gets released into the air and infects other people nearby.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The common cold is not spread through food or water. It is spread through the air when an infected person coughs or sneezes. The tiny droplets in the air contain the cold virus, and when another person breathes them in, they can catch the cold.

questions.question_text: Washing hands does not help prevent diseases.
questions.explanation_correct: Washing your hands is very important to prevent the spread of diseases. When you wash your hands with soap and water, it removes germs and bacteria that can make you sick. This helps stop the spread of illnesses like colds, flu, and COVID-19 that can spread through contact with surfaces and other people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that washing your hands does not help prevent diseases. Washing your hands regularly is one of the best ways to stay healthy and avoid getting sick. Germs and bacteria can spread easily from person to person, but washing your hands with soap and water removes these and stops them from entering your body and making you ill.

questions.question_text: Goitre is caused by lack of iodine.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, that's correct! Goitre is caused by lack of iodine in the body. Iodine is a mineral that is needed for the thyroid gland to work properly. When there is not enough iodine, the thyroid gland becomes enlarged, which leads to a condition called goitre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that is not correct. Goitre is caused by a lack of iodine in the body, not by other nutrients like vitamins or proteins. The thyroid gland in the neck needs iodine to function properly. When there is not enough iodine, the thyroid gland becomes enlarged, leading to a condition called goitre.

questions.question_text: Water is not an essential nutrient.
questions.explanation_correct: Water is an essential nutrient for our body. It is needed for all the processes that happen inside our body, like digestion, absorption, and blood circulation. Our body cannot function properly without water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not an essential nutrient because it does not provide energy or help in growth and repair of our body. However, water is very important for our body and we need to drink enough water every day to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Night blindness is caused by lack of Vitamin A.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, night blindness is caused by a lack of Vitamin A in the diet. Vitamin A is important for keeping our eyes healthy and allowing us to see in the dark. When we don't get enough Vitamin A, we start having trouble seeing at night or in dim light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Night blindness is not caused by a lack of other vitamins like Vitamin C or Vitamin D. It is specifically caused by not getting enough Vitamin A in our food. Vitamin A helps our eyes work properly, so when we don't have enough of it, we start having trouble seeing at night.

questions.question_text: For a minor burn, you should apply butter immediately.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B, because you should not apply butter to a minor burn. Butter can actually make the burn worse and increase the risk of infection. Instead, you should run cool water over the burn for several minutes to cool it down and prevent further damage.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Applying butter to a minor burn is not the right thing to do. Butter can trap heat and cause more damage to the skin. It can also lead to infection. The correct way to treat a minor burn is to run cool water over it for a few minutes to cool it down and then cover it with a clean, dry cloth. This helps soothe the burn and prevent further injury.

questions.question_text: _____ provide energy to our body.
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body. They get converted into glucose, which the cells in our body use to produce energy for all our activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'Carbohydrates'. Carbohydrates are the nutrients that provide energy to our body. They get broken down into glucose, which our cells use to produce energy. Fats and proteins can also provide some energy, but carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body.

questions.question_text: _____ are needed for growth and repair of body tissues.
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are the nutrient that helps with growth and repair of our body tissues. They are the building blocks that our body uses to make new cells and fix damaged ones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Proteins'. Proteins, not carbohydrates or fats, are the nutrients that help our body grow and repair tissues. Carbohydrates provide energy, while fats store extra energy in our body. Proteins are the specific nutrient that is needed for the growth and repair of our body tissues.

questions.question_text: A diet containing all nutrients in right amounts is called a _____ diet.
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet is called so because it contains all the six essential nutrients - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water - in the right amounts that our body needs to function properly and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diet that is not balanced would be missing one or more of the six essential nutrients. For example, a diet with only carbohydrates and fats but no proteins, vitamins, and minerals would not be a balanced diet. The correct answer is 'balanced' because a balanced diet has all the nutrients in the right quantities.

questions.question_text: Scurvy is caused by lack of Vitamin _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by a lack of vitamin C in the diet. Vitamin C is important for keeping our gums and teeth healthy, as well as helping our body absorb iron. Without enough vitamin C, we can develop scurvy, which causes bleeding gums, loose teeth, and other problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scurvy is not caused by a lack of vitamin A, D, or any other vitamin - it is specifically caused by a lack of vitamin C. The correct answer is vitamin C. Vitamin C is an essential nutrient that helps our body in many ways, including keeping our gums and teeth healthy. When we don't get enough vitamin C, we can develop a disease called scurvy.

questions.question_text: _____ is caused by lack of Vitamin D.
questions.explanation_correct: Rickets is a disease caused by a lack of Vitamin D in the body. Vitamin D is important for our bones to grow and become strong. Without enough Vitamin D, our bones can become weak and misshapen, leading to the disease called rickets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Rickets'. Rickets is a disease that happens when the body doesn't have enough Vitamin D. Vitamin D is needed for our bones to grow properly. If we don't have enough Vitamin D, our bones can become weak and misshapen, causing the disease called rickets. Therefore, the lack of Vitamin D leads to the condition of rickets.

questions.question_text: Lack of iodine causes _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Lack of iodine in the diet causes a condition called goitre, where the thyroid gland in the neck becomes enlarged. This is because the thyroid gland needs iodine to function properly, and without enough iodine, it tries to compensate by growing bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The lack of iodine in the diet does not cause scurvy, rickets, anaemia, or night blindness. These are caused by deficiencies of other nutrients like Vitamin C, Vitamin D, iron, and Vitamin A respectively. The correct answer is goitre, a condition where the thyroid gland becomes enlarged due to lack of iodine.

questions.question_text: _____ is caused by lack of iron in the diet.
questions.explanation_correct: Anaemia is caused by lack of iron in the diet. Iron is an important mineral that helps your body make red blood cells, which carry oxygen to all parts of your body. Without enough iron, you can feel tired, weak, and have other health problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Anaemia. Anaemia is a condition where you don't have enough healthy red blood cells in your body, which can make you feel tired and weak. This is caused by not getting enough iron in your diet. Other deficiency diseases like scurvy, rickets, and goitre are caused by lack of different nutrients, not iron.

questions.question_text: Diseases that spread from person to person are called _____ diseases.
questions.explanation_correct: Diseases that spread from person to person are called 'communicable' diseases. This means they can be passed on or 'communicated' from one person to another, through things like coughing, sneezing, or contact with contaminated surfaces or food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format for this question is 'communicable'. Diseases that spread from person to person are not called 'transmissible' or 'infectious' diseases - those terms have slightly different meanings. 'Communicable' is the right word to describe diseases that can be passed on from one person to another.

questions.question_text: Washing _____ regularly helps prevent the spread of germs.
questions.explanation_correct: Washing your hands regularly helps prevent the spread of germs because germs can easily spread from person to person through contact. When you wash your hands with soap and water, you remove the germs on your hands and stop them from spreading to others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'hands'. Washing your hands regularly with soap and water is important to prevent the spread of germs. Germs can easily spread through touch, so keeping your hands clean is the best way to stop the spread of illnesses. Other body parts like feet or face do not spread germs as easily as your hands, which you use to touch many surfaces throughout the day.

questions.question_text: _____ is the mineral needed for strong bones and teeth.
questions.explanation_correct: Calcium is the mineral that our bones and teeth need to be strong and healthy. It helps build and maintain strong bones and teeth, which is very important as we grow and develop.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The mineral needed for strong bones and teeth is calcium. Calcium helps our bones and teeth grow and stay strong. The correct answer format is 'Calcium'.

questions.question_text: _____ are nutrients that protect us from diseases.
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamins are the nutrients that protect our body from diseases. They help our body fight infections and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Vitamins'. Vitamins are the nutrients that protect our body from diseases like scurvy, rickets, and night blindness. They are not the nutrients that provide energy (carbohydrates), help us grow (proteins), or store energy (fats). The question is asking specifically about the nutrients that protect us from diseases, so the answer is vitamins.

questions.question_text: Night _____ is caused by lack of Vitamin A.
questions.explanation_correct: Night blindness is caused by a lack of Vitamin A in the diet. Vitamin A is important for good vision, especially in low light conditions. Without enough Vitamin A, your eyes cannot adjust properly to the dark, leading to night blindness.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'blindness'. Night blindness is a condition where a person has trouble seeing in the dark or in low light. This is caused by a lack of Vitamin A in the diet. Vitamin A is essential for good vision, so not getting enough of it can lead to night blindness.

questions.question_text: Arrange the nutrients by their main function (energy first):
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates provide energy for our bodies, so they should be listed first. Proteins help our bodies grow and repair, so they should be listed second. Vitamins protect our bodies from diseases, so they should be listed last.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The nutrients should be arranged in the order of their main functions. Carbohydrates provide energy for our bodies, so they should be listed first. Proteins help our bodies grow and repair, so they should be listed second. Vitamins protect our bodies from diseases, so they should be listed last. This order is important to remember the different roles each nutrient plays in keeping us healthy.

questions.question_text: Arrange the first aid steps for a minor cut:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of first aid steps for a minor cut is: Clean the wound, Apply antiseptic, Apply bandage. This is important because you first need to clean the cut to remove any dirt or germs, then apply antiseptic to kill any bacteria, and finally cover it with a bandage to protect the wound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Apply bandage, Clean the wound, Apply antiseptic. This is wrong because you should not apply a bandage before cleaning the wound. Cleaning the wound first is important to remove any dirt or germs, then you can apply antiseptic, and finally cover it with a bandage.

questions.question_text: Arrange the hygiene practices from morning to night:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Brush teeth in the morning, Wash hands before eating, Wash hands before sleeping. This is because we should start our day by brushing our teeth, then wash our hands before meals to remove germs, and finally wash our hands before bed to stay clean overnight.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Wash hands before eating, Wash hands before sleeping, Brush teeth in the morning. This is not correct because we should brush our teeth first thing in the morning to keep our mouth clean, then wash our hands before meals and before bed to maintain good hygiene throughout the day.

questions.question_text: Arrange how a disease spreads:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Germs enter body, Germs multiply, Person becomes sick. This is because germs (like viruses or bacteria) first need to get into your body, then they multiply and grow inside you, and finally you become sick as a result.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Person becomes sick, Germs enter body, Germs multiply. This is wrong because the germs have to first enter your body before they can multiply and make you sick. The germs don't just appear inside you after you become sick. They have to infect you first, then they spread and grow, which leads to you getting the illness.

questions.question_text: Arrange the food digestion process:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Food is eaten, Food is digested, Energy is released' because this is the sequence of how our body uses the food we eat. First, we eat the food. Then, our body breaks down and digests the food. Finally, the energy from the food is released and used by our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is 'Energy is released, Food is eaten, Food is digested'. This is not the right order because energy is not released until after the food has been digested. The correct order is to first eat the food, then digest the food, and finally the energy from the food is released and used by our body.
